cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 325 mi SW of Manzanillo, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest, then north-northwest, paralleling the Pacific coast of Baja California and moving toward the waters off southern California late this week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Pacific coast of Baja California (near Punta Eugenia, Mexico)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Loreto southward around Cape San Lucas to Punta Abreojos, Baja California Sur
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-western Mexico, the entire Baja California peninsula, the Gulf of California, and eventually the southern California coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible late Friday-Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding and high surf possible along exposed beaches; surge heights not expected to exceed 2 ft inside the bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Kay could bring brief heavy showers to the San Diego area Friday night into Saturday, generally 0.5–1.5 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells and dangerous rip currents will affect port approaches and outer anchorages beginning late Thursday and persisting through the weekend.
